p: Compared to mosquito/ Culicoides-borne viruses, tick-borne viruses are not likely to expand their range within a short period of time. However, it was suggested that migratory birds play an important role as long-distance transporters for ticks infected with arboviruses ( 224, 225). The role of birds in any sudden incursion and occurrence of tick-borne virus infections in a region that was previously free of the infections should thus be considered.
